Issues.Title: ChunkLoadErrors can occur due to HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR
Issues.Body:
> If a user is on our website during deployment and they navigate to a lazy loaded feature of the app they get a ChunkLoadError. After refreshing the page everything works fine. Like @karptonite said I'm assuming it's because the module name has changed on the server. 
>
> Is there any way to resolve this issue? We know that we could use the preloadAllModules feature but figured that kinda defeats the purpose of lazy loading.

_Originally posted by @skcarnes in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/44780#issuecomment-1021577113_
            

We have the same issue, but this time I can reproduce it. If you run on a Windows Server, or another server that engages in the HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR due to bandwidth warnings being tripped; Essentially, if the server detects there is too much outbound traffic, it'll shut down some of those requests without much warning.

To reproduce the error, you could add a setting to the angular-cli or other server which would be flaky intentionally with responses.


What can we do to resolve this? It seems the only thing to do is to reload the app.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ChunkLoadErrors can occur due to HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR" (#49516)

Issues.Title: Improve Changelog viewing experience
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

As a person responsible for framework and package updates in an enterprise project, I find it very difficult to figure out the changes between any two releases in a concise form. The incremental and very verbose format of CHANGELOG.md doesn't help (and it also fails to list some important changes) and takes a lot time to digest and scroll through (and to filter `next` and `rc` releases as well).

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

angular.io; update.angular.io

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

aggregated diff of Changelog between any two selected releases

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

tried consuming CHANGLELOG.md as well as tried using update.angular.io

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

I would see an interface place at angular.io that would allow me to pick any two public releases - down to a patch - and get a 'diff' in a very concise, human-readable form, that could be pasted or linked to in internal communications channel in an organization. This would allow teams to quickly recognize what improvements, what deprecations were made, as well as to which areas need more attention when conducting acceptance tests after an update.

I think the following issues should be addressed to improve this experience:

1. Format of the logs - these should be grouped by areas, aggregated (ie. without intermediate releases in between), no tables, pure text and github links. I am not sure using git commit messages for communication is a good solution - they may get too technical. Would be great if the most prominent features could be listed at the top.
2. Missing minor and patch releases - update.angular.io has stopped listing minor/patch releases since v11. If you want to figure out a diff between `14.1.1` and `15.2.3` - you're out of luck.
3. Separately listed, but also aggregated, Deprecation notes (actual deprecations that took place, not the intended ones - so this is a bit different from this section https://angular.io/guide/deprecations
4. If the checkboxes (like `[ ] I use Angular Material`) are to be kept, there should also be `[ ] I use Angular CDK` and perhaps some more (forms?)


### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

_No response_

### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here

_No response_

### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

_No response_

### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can

_No response_

Issues.Title: feat(http): allow `HttpClient` to cache requests
Issues.Body:
This commit adds a new option for `provideHttpClient` called `withTransferCache()`. When this option is passed, requests done on the server are cached and reused during the  bootstrapping of the application in the browser thus avoiding duplicate requests and reducing load time.

This is the same as `TransferHttpCacheModule` in https://github.com/angular/universal/blob/main/modules/common/src/transfer_http.ts and is part of the effort to move "common" logic that can be used without "@nguniversal/common" into the framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(http): allow `HttpClient` to cache requests" (#49509)

Issues.Title: Export `PreloadLinkCreator` and `DEFAULT_PRELOADED_IMAGES_LIMIT` as part of public API for `NgOptimizeImage`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

@angular/common

### Description

Currently the `PreloadLinkCreator` and `DEFAULT_PRELOADED_IMAGES_LIMIT`  are private API and cannot be exported via `@angular/common` package. The context for this usage is that we want to ship our own implementation of `PreloadLinkCreator` and provide it by overriding the instance via DI. The current implementation does not work for us since it only appends at the end of [`head` tag](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/35a3fde5b71ef3b50282fe6f7b37ca1c92b8d2a0/packages/common/src/directives/ng_optimized_image/preload-link-creator.ts#L78). We want to insert it in any place of the head so that discovery of the link preload tags can be done earlier and not blocked by any render blocking resource.

### Proposed solution

Expose `PreloadLinkCreator` and `DEFAULT_PRELOADED_IMAGES_LIMIT` as part of the public API.

### Alternatives considered

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Export `PreloadLinkCreator` and `DEFAULT_PRELOADED_IMAGES_LIMIT` as part of public API for `NgOptimizeImage`" (#49506)

Issues.Title: Add extended template diagnostic to make sure `ngSkipHydration` is not a binding
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

The `ngSkipHydration` is a special attribute that instructs Angular that hydration logic should be skipped for a given component, for example:
```
<cmp ngSkipHydration />
```
Angular expects this attribute to be known statically (i.e. it can not be a binding) and also it can not have values other than `"true"` or an empty value. This would be covered in documentation, but it'd be also great to add a template diagnostic to make sure that:
- a node doesn't have the `ngSkipHydration` in bindings
- the value of the `ngSkipHydration` is within the allowed range (`['true', '' /* empty string */]`)

The implementation would likely be very similar to [the `TextAttributeNotBindingSpec` check](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/typecheck/extended/checks/text_attribute_not_binding/index.ts#L23).

Also related PR with a runtime check: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/49500.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add extended template diagnostic to make sure `ngSkipHydration` is not a binding" (#49501)

Issues.Title: $localize missed by jest runner
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Since `$localize` is not explicitly initialized anymore, but just included as type and initialized by cli, I think external test runners have some issues.
In particular, I'm using `vscode-jest-runner` extension, and when I use its codeLens option to run a single test, it fails if the components involved use i18n, because it can't find `$localize`, despite the type being listed in `tsconfig.spec.json`'s `types`. 
When running test architect from cli everything works.
At the moment my workaround is to explicitly initialize `$localize` in `test-setup.ts` with the old `import '@angular/localize/init';`, hoping this will not interfere when test are launched from cli (double initialization?).
Is there any other way?

### Minimal Reproduction

- use i18n in a component
- test the component outside ng-cli


### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.3
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: npm 9.5.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 15.2.2
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.3
```

-   Fix a crash when parsing inline TypeScript decorators ([#​2991](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2991))

    Previously esbuild's TypeScript parser crashed when parsing TypeScript decorators if the definition of the decorator was inlined into the decorator itself:

    ```ts
    @​(function sealed(constructor: Function) {
      Object.seal(constructor);
      Object.seal(constructor.prototype);
    })
    class Foo {}
    ```

    This crash was not noticed earlier because this edge case did not have test coverage. The crash is fixed in this release.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): consolidate result file writes in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: As a preparation step to allow for in-memory build outputs to support the development server, the output result files of the build are now written to the file system in one location. This includes the generated files from the bundling steps as well as any assets and service worker files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): consolidate result file writes in esbuild builder" (#24885)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): initial tailwindcss support for CSS in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, CSS stylesheets will now be processed by tailwindcss if a tailwind configuration file is present and the `tailwindcss` package has been installed in the project. This provides equivalent behavior to the use of tailwind with the current default Webpack-based build system. Currently, only CSS stylesheets are processed. Preprocessor support including Sass and Less will be added in a future change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): initial tailwindcss support for CSS in esbuild builder" (#24888)

Issues.Title: Cannot create an Angular project under a path containing the '#' character
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler, core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When an Angular project is created under a path that contains the `#` character (like `/home/arnaud/C#/my-project/frontend`), this character will be misinterpreted by Angular

Steps to reproduce : 

```
mkdir C#
cd C\#/
ng new --routing false --style css my-app
cd my-app
npm start
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

Not relevant

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
                    | Initial Total |   1.66 MB

Build at: 2023-03-21T11:05:40.110Z - Hash: 18bec7f1f615ec1f - Time: 7185ms

Error: Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '/home/arnaud/code/test-zone/C#/my-app/node_modules/webpack-dev-server/client/index.js?protocol=auto%3A&username=&password=&hostname=0.0.0.0&port=0&pathname=%2Fng-cli-ws&logging=info&overlay=%7B%22errors%22%3Atrue%2C%22warnings%22%3Afalse%7D&reconnect=10&hot=false&live-reload=true' in '/home/arnaud/code/test-zone/C#/my-app'

Error: Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '/home/arnaud/code/test-zone/C#/my-app/src/app/app.component.css?ngResource' in '/home/arnaud/code/test-zone/C#/my-app'

Error: The loader "/home/arnaud/code/test-zone/C#/my-app/src/app/app.component.css" didn't return a string.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
code/test-zone [ ng version
```

- or explain the good reason why it is not allowed and/or make the error message more clear about this

Issues.Title: Angular Circular Dependencies - removing showCircularDependency flag has resulted in problems for big enterprise applications
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Angular has removed the showCircularDependency flag. I understand it is for performance improvement, But for already existing big enterprise-level applications, with many developers, it poses a big problem. Since many devs are working, an import-based circular dependency can be easily inserted in any part of the code, and with the useful 'circular dependency warnings' removed, there is no way to find such issues. And these issues may cause application to actually break in production. Which causes a huge impact on our reputation with the customer. We tried the alternatives suggested, but no luck

1) Eslint -> import/no-cycle -> Makes our linter in CI run for more than 1.5 hours and finally breaks
14:55:00  Linting "@abcd/mnop-efgh"...
16:27:07  Cannot contact xyz-slave1: java.lang.InterruptedException
This is probably because our application is very big

2) Madge -> Only found the type-based circular dependencies and no other circular dependencies... It is able to detect all circ-deps for a smaller application, But since our app is huge it is probably not able to find anything relevant.

### Proposed solution

1) Keep the showCircularDependencies flag for development and not have it in production. In the angular.json we can have a warning, if showCircularDependencies is set to true, stating, "Do not use in Production as it will slow the build".

2) Angular can have another script, which after running can let us know the circular dependency warnings. This script can be based on the build, used in Angular-13 or before... which finds circular dependencies. This script will be different from the build so no performance impact will be there.

### Alternatives considered

As mentioned above eslint and madge were tried, but no value was added.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Circular Dependencies - removing showCircularDependency flag has resulted in problems for big enterprise applications" (#24870)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add CSP support for inline styles
Issues.Body: Companion change to https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/49444. Adds an HTML processor that finds the `ngCspNonce` attribute and copies its value to any inline `style` tags in the HTML. The processor runs late in the processing pipeline in order to pick up any `style` tag that might've been added by other processors (e.g. critical CSS).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add CSP support for inline styles" (#24880)

Issues.Title: "Port 4200 is already in use" when running the ng serve command
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

Issues.Title: Don't duplicate assets referenced in CSS/SCSS files
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Description

When referencing files in CSS/SCSS they get duplicated and placed in the root folder:

```background: url('../assets/icons/menu.svg');```

Now the file gets deployed twice:

- assets/icons/menu.svg
- menu.svg

Using an absolute path `/assets/icons/menu.svg` doesnt duplicate the files BUT it doesnt work when deployed to a sub-folder using `base-href`.

Personally I don't see any reason for that and I dont want to have all my assets deployed twice.

This was already a feature request from 2017 which had a lot of people upvoting / commenting but has been closed: 
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6692


### Describe the solution you'd like

- Don't duplicate linked assets
- Deploying to a sub-folder using `base-root` it should still work

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Don't duplicate assets referenced in CSS/SCSS files" (#24882)

Issues.Body:
Bumps up the dev dependency to TS 5 and narrows the required version to exclude 4.8.

BREAKING CHANGE:
* TypeScript 4.8 is no longer supported.

Issues.Title: @angular-devkit/build-angular depends on vulnarable version of webpack
Issues.Body:
### Command

new

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Running `npm audit` on Angular v15 project causes an error output, because `@angular-devkit/build-angular` depends on vulnerable version of webpack `5.75.0`.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create new Angular project using the latest `@angular-cli` version `15.2.3`.
2. Run `npm audit` in the project folder

### Exception or Error

```text
webpack  5.0.0 - 5.75.0
Severity: high
Cross-realm object access in Webpack 5 - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hc6q-2mpp-qw7j
fix available via `npm audit fix --force`
Will install @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.1101.2, which is a breaking change
node_modules/webpack
  @angular-devkit/build-angular  0.1200.0-next.0 - 16.0.0-next.3
  Depends on vulnerable versions of webpack
  node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular

2 high severity vulnerabilities
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.3
Node: 16.15.1
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.2
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.3
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.3
@angular/cli                    15.2.3
@schematics/angular             15.2.3
rxjs                            7.8.0
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): apply strong focus styles to selected option
Issues.Body:
Apply strong focus styles to the selected option. Do this by putting the `.mat-mdc-focus-indicator` class on the ripple element.

Fix issue where the List styles from MDC override the strong focus style, which causes the strong focus indicator to not be present on selected option (angular#26801).

Align maat-option with list-item's implementation by putting the focus indicator on a child element of the component root, rather than directly on the component root.

Does not add aditional DOM nodes.

Issues.Title: bug(mat-tabs): Example of mat-tabs deletion is showing wrong index
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If we have three tabs and we navigate to the second tab or the 1st index and delete the first tab or the 0th index the selectedIndex doesnt update .

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to angular material website https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/examples, Under header 'Tab group with dynamically changing tabs'. Open Stackblitz.
2. Remove the delete button html code from inside the mat-tab and place it outside the mat tab. Instead of passing index of mat-tab to remove function just pass 0 like (click)="removeTab(0)"
3. Navigate to Tab1 or index =1 for mat tab and hit the delete button. The first mat tab gets deleted but the selectedIndex.value is still 1 in the screen. 
4. It only stops working when the currentIndex = 1 and we delete the 0th index

Issues.Title: docs-bug(MatSlider): displayWith handler losing implementation context
Issues.Body:
I'm logging this issue as a continuation of the discussion in #26789.

The context of the issue is the following: the mat-slider's `displayWith` handler loses the component's context into handler implementation. We had a little conversation with @crisbeto where I provided a description of why the issue occurs, as well as a simple replication scenario, which is as follows:

`sample-slider.component.html`
```html
<mat-slider ... [displayWith]=handlerFunction">
```
and

`sample-slider.component.ts`
```ts
...
export class SampleSliderComponent {
   ...
   private _innerProperty: string = 'I want to show this text into the thumbnail formatting';

   public handlerFunction(value: number): string {
      return `${this._innerProperty} - ${value}`;
   }
}
```
_Originally posted by @3phase in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/26789#issuecomment-1470132741_

The one way to solve the issue is by explicitly setting the component's context when referring to the property, something like that:

```html
...
<mat-slider [displayWith]="handlerFunction.bind(this)></mat-slider>
```
but I think it's a hacky solution and at least has to be mentioned in the docs.
I'd either try to refactor the code so that the context isn't lost by invoking the handler from the logic of the MatSlider component (and therefore switching the implementation context), or mention it into the docs so that users don't get perplexed by the weird context shift.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(MatSlider): displayWith handler losing implementation context" (#26810)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): mat-options not showing up on dynamically generated component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi, this is my first issue, so I hope everything is corrent.

I'm currently implementing some map popups (using leaflet, but I assume the issue would also appear for other map providers) in my app, using dynamically generated components as their content. Within that components, I have a mat-select, which is not displaying any options, as the title mentioned. When I click on it, the select field itself is focused and gets the correct classes, but the options overlay is not appearing.

My guess is, that something is wrong with the handling of the overlay in combination with dynamically generated components. When checking the DOM, I could see that the overlay container was not added to the body. Outside of the dynamic component the exact same mat-select works as expected. I also tried to create a dialog within my dynamic component and it also works fine (overlay container is attached to the body).

Every other functionality within the component is working as well (root services, ngrx store, ...).

There are no console errors.

Module imports contain MatSelectModule, MatInputModule & MatFormFieldModule.

Is this a bug or am I just missing something?

### Reproduction

1. add mat-select to popupComponent:
```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill">
	<mat-select multiple [formControl]="statusFormControl">
		<mat-option *ngFor="let status of statuses" [value]="status">{{ status.id }}</mat-option>
	</mat-select>
</mat-form-field>
```


2. Generate Component with createComponent(), using a generic EnvironmentInjector:

`const popupComponent: ComponentRef<PopupComponent> = createComponent(PopupComponent, {
	environmentInjector: this._environmentInjector
});`


3. Add data to the component and execute change detection:

`component.instance.statuses = statuses;
component.changeDetectorRef.detectChanges();`


4. bind content to map popup (might be a possible source for the bug as well):

`mapMarker.bindPopup(popupComponent.location.nativeElement as Content);`


5. when opening the popup on the map and clicking on the select, the highlighting is correct, but nothing else happens:

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/125544629/225877898-4a2c8117-ce56-41ac-9fc0-37570d2e91da.png)


### Expected Behavior

mat-options should show up

### Actual Behavior

mat-options notshowing up, overlay container not attached

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.2
- CDK/Material: 15.1.4
- Browser(s): Firefox 102.8
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): mat-options not showing up on dynamically generated component" (#26803)

Issues.Title: bug(dialog): MDC dialog text color fails to pass WCAG AAA contrast tests
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

The MDC dialog content has a poor contrast that fails to pass WCAG AAA tests, as seen in screenshot.

In both cases the background is white, `#ffffff`. Before, in v14, the text was `#212121` with a contrast of 16.1:1, according to https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/. After, in v15 with MDC, the new text color is `#666666`, which clearly has a lower contrast of only 5.74:1.

Screenshot straight from https://v14.material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview and https://rc.material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72603/225563921-0e0722ea-0e76-49cf-be4f-8d5753eda27f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72603/225564505-387ab2a2-50cc-4629-a0ff-1e5ee3e0c8eb.png)


### Reproduction

See screenshots

### Expected Behavior

For such as simple and common use-case, I expect it to pass even the strictest contrast tests, such as WCAG AAA.

Or at the very least, we should have clear instructions on how to properly configure this, in order to pass WCAG AAA.

### Actual Behavior

It fails WCAG AAA, and thus is less readable in sub-optimal conditions.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Chrome 111
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu 22.04
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(dialog): MDC dialog text color fails to pass WCAG AAA contrast tests" (#26797)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(MatSlider): displayWith handler losing implementation context
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

I was wondering whether there's a specific reason for implementing the `displayWith` property in the [Mat Slider](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/slider/slider.ts#L357) as an arrow function.
As a side effect, the arrow function makes the handler lose the this-context of the component, where it's implemented. 
Thus, the implementation would always refer to the `MatSlider`-component properties instead of the component-specific ones.

If there's a reason for that implementation, I guess it's going to be helpful to be mentioned in the documentation, because so far I wasn't able to find anything relevant.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/slider/api
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "docs-bug(MatSlider): displayWith handler losing implementation context" (#26789)

### Documentation Feedback

The documentation for the CDK:Dialog does not reference the prebuilt css it uses (aka: overlay-prebuilt.css).
It also does not reference the fact that it uses the overlay API under the hood.

Currently if a developer reads the documentation for dialog, he/she has no way of knowing that a standard css styling is available. He/she can only figure this out by actually using the dialog and spotting that overlay classes are applied on the dialog that is opened.

https://material.angular.io/cdk/dialog/overview

Issues.Title: Table matNoDataRow missing "mdc-data-table__row"
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

### Description

When the table row selector `matNoDataRow` is hit it doesn't include the class `mdc-data-table__row`. I guess that's the default class for a row!
